references.paper_title: Equilibrium propagation: Bridging the gap between energy-based models and backpropagation
references.reason: This paper introduces the Equilibrium Propagation (EP) algorithm, a core concept of the current work, providing a theoretical framework for training energy-based models without backpropagation.

references.paper_title: Updates of equilibrium prop match gradients of backprop through time in an rnn with static input
references.reason: This paper shows the equivalence of EP and backpropagation in RNNs with static inputs, providing critical insight into the relationship between these two gradient computation methods.

references.paper_title: Scaling equilibrium propagation to deep convnets by drastically reducing its gradient estimator bias
references.reason: This paper addresses the scalability of EP to deep convolutional networks, a significant challenge tackled by the current work through a hybrid approach.
This paper introduces Deep Equilibrium Models (DEQs), which are closely related to the energy-based models used in the current work, influencing the model design and architecture.

references.paper_title: Energy-based learning algorithms for analog computing: a comparative study
references.reason: This paper provides a comprehensive comparative study of various energy-based learning algorithms, offering valuable context for choosing a suitable approach for analog hardware.
